content:
Yes, the Ripon City Hall building has undergone several major renovations and updates since its initial construction in 1901. In 1934, the building was expanded with the addition of a third story, which provided additional office space. Over the years, various upgrades and renovations have been made to the building, including the installation of new heating and cooling systems, the modernization of the electrical system, and the replacement of the roof.

In 2016, the City of Ripon initiated a major renovation of the building to modernize it and improve accessibility. The renovation included the installation of a new elevator, the addition of a new accessible restroom, and the installation of a new HVAC system. The exterior of the building was also restored, which included repointing of the brickwork and replacement of the windows.

Overall, the various renovations and updates to the Ripon City Hall building have helped to preserve its historical character while ensuring that it remains functional and accessible for use by the city government and the community.
